title: Configure GitHub webhook for Flux
description: Configure GitHub webhook to send push events to Flux for automatic reconciliation on git push
acceptance_criteria:
- Command `kubectl -n flux-system get receiver github-webhook --output=jsonpath='{.status.webhookPath}'` returns webhook path
- Full webhook URL is constructed with format: https://flux-webhook.${cloudflare_domain}/hook/{path}
- Webhook is added to GitHub repository settings
- Webhook payload URL is set correctly
- Content type is set to application/json
- Secret token from github-push-token.txt is configured
- Events are set to "Just the push event"
- Webhook is saved and active

title: Fix network configuration conflicts (etcd + routes)
description:
Multiple network configuration issues on the cluster nodes:

**Issue 1: etcd Peer URL Conflict**
Node esxi-2cu-8g-01 (10.0.0.146) has duplicate peer URLs in etcd (10.0.0.128 and 10.0.0.146), causing "Peer URLs already exists" error. Node is currently unreachable.

**Issue 2: Network Route Conflict**
Nodes are showing route conflict errors:
```
error adding route: netlink receive: file exists
gateway: 10.0.0.129
```

This is because nodes were previously configured with `/24` subnet and gateway `10.0.0.1`, but now configured with `/27` subnet and gateway `10.0.0.129`. Old routes persist.

**Root Cause:**
Configuration changed from:
- Old: 10.0.0.0/24, gateway 10.0.0.1
- New: 10.0.0.128/27, gateway 10.0.0.129

**Solution:**
1. Reset ALL nodes to clear old network config
2. Re-apply Talos configuration
3. Bootstrap cluster fresh

Commands:
```bash
# Reset each node
talosctl -n 10.0.0.145 reset --graceful=false --reboot
talosctl -n 10.0.0.146 reset --graceful=false --reboot  
talosctl -n 10.0.0.147 reset --graceful=false --reboot

# Wait for nodes to boot into maintenance mode, then:
task bootstrap:talos
```
acceptance_criteria:
- Member ceeb52e03fde8032 is removed from etcd cluster
- Node 10.0.0.146 is reset and reconfigured
- Node rejoins etcd cluster with correct peer URL
- `talosctl etcd members` shows only one peer URL per member
- All three nodes are healthy in etcd cluster
notes:
**Recommended Fix: Full Cluster Reset (Option 1)**

All nodes are currently offline. Once nodes are back online, execute:

```bash
# Reset all nodes to maintenance mode
talosctl -n 10.0.0.145 reset --graceful=false --reboot --insecure
talosctl -n 10.0.0.146 reset --graceful=false --reboot --insecure
talosctl -n 10.0.0.147 reset --graceful=false --reboot --insecure

# Wait for nodes to boot into maintenance mode (~2-3 min)
# Verify with: nmap -Pn -n -p 50000 10.0.0.145-147 -vv

# Re-bootstrap
task bootstrap:talos
task bootstrap:apps
```

This is the cleanest approach to clear all lingering network config and etcd state issues. Estimated time: ~15 minutes total.
close_reason: Fixed - etcd cluster healthy with 3 members, each with single peer URL. No route conflicts. All cluster health checks passed.

title: Push talhelper encrypted secret to git

acceptance_criteria:
- Changes are staged with `git add -A`
- Commit is created with message "chore: add talhelper encrypted secret :lock:"
- Changes are pushed to remote repository
close_reason: Successfully staged, committed, and pushed talhelper encrypted secret to git repository

title: Verify Flux status and resources
description: Check the status of Flux and verify all Flux resources are up-to-date and in a ready state
acceptance_criteria:
- Command `flux check` passes all checks
- Command `flux get sources git flux-system` shows ready state
- Command `flux get ks -A` shows all kustomizations ready
- Command `flux get hr -A` shows all helm releases ready

title: Tidy up repository (remove templates)
description: Clean up the repository by removing the templates directory and templating-related files to eliminate clutter and resolve Renovate warnings
acceptance_criteria:
- Command `task template:tidy` completes successfully
- Templates directory is removed
- Templating-related files are cleaned up
- Changes are committed with message "chore: tidy up :broom:"
- Changes are pushed to git

title: Bootstrap cluster applications (cilium, coredns, spegel, flux)
description: Install cilium, coredns, spegel, flux and sync the cluster to the repository state
acceptance_criteria:
- Command `task bootstrap:apps` completes successfully
- Cilium is installed
- CoreDNS is installed
- Spegel is installed
- Flux is installed
- Cluster is synced to repository state
close_reason: Successfully installed cilium, coredns, spegel, cert-manager, flux-operator. Flux-instance is reconciling (timeout is normal). All nodes are Ready.

title: Finish monitoring system setup

description: Check that DNS resolution works for the echo subdomain and resolves to the Cloudflare gateway address

title: Verify TCP connectivity to gateways
description: Check TCP connectivity to both the internal and external gateways on port 443
acceptance_criteria:
- Command `nmap -Pn -n -p 443 ${cluster_gateway_addr} ${cloudflare_gateway_addr} -vv` succeeds
- Port 443 is open on both internal and external gateways
- TCP connectivity is confirmed

title: Verify Cilium status
description: Verify that Cilium is installed and running correctly
acceptance_criteria:
- Command `cilium status` runs successfully
- Cilium reports healthy status
- All Cilium components are operational

title: Verify wildcard Certificate status
description: Check the status of the wildcard Certificate in the network namespace
acceptance_criteria:

title: Install homepage dashboard
description: Create the homepage application manifests (helmrelease, ocirepository, kustomization) in kubernetes/apps/default/homepage/app/ directory and configure the ks.yaml to deploy it

title: Install home assistant for home automation
description:
Create home assistant application manifests (helmrelease, ocirepository, kustomization) in kubernetes/apps/default/home-assistant/app/ directory and configure deployment.

Note: Ensure the application has network access to the IoT VLAN where most smart home devices are located. This may require configuring network policies or multus CNI for VLAN access.
